intro: Seidelia mercurialis, commonly known as the mercury lichen, is a member of the family Parmeliaceae. It is a foliose lichen that forms a thin, flat, greenish to yellowish thallus. The plant is characterized by its ability to grow on rocks and tree bark in arid and semi-arid environments. It contains a variety of secondary metabolites, including usnic acid, which contributes to its chemical complexity. Seidelia mercurialis is widely distributed across North America and parts of Europe.
